page.title: 01North West Berwickshire
page.content: The center and east of block are covered by Moorland mainly grass with small areas of Heather grazed by blackfaced sheep. The surrounding area consists of farmland of a pastoral nature. Some rough grazing and intensively managed grass combined with a small acreage of grain which I used for stock feeding. Beef cattle are also seen on lower ground. Highest point is 240m at extreme south east but is nowhere lower than about 200m. The North west corner is bisected for 2 kms by the B6456 which is the only classified road. Population is sparse and is engaged totally in agriculture. The only trees are planted as shelter belts in various parts.
